item.title: Expert OT Security Architecture
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

 The purpose of this role is to evaluate Operational Technology (OT) solutions, configurations, and designs against security requirements, and define cybersecurity reference architectures and standards for all OT environments at CN.

 

Main Responsibilities

 OT Security Architecture Practice 

·       Put in place the proper sets of OT security architecture controls to ensure authenticity, non-repudiation, and least privilege commensurate with risk requirements.

·       Ensure the OT security architecture is maintainable, sustainable and properly documented.

·       Maintain and build relevant, current, valid and reliable team knowledge related to OT and Security Architecture to leverage existing cybersecurity infrastructure and process, where appropriate, while supporting Transportation, Mechanical and Network Ops functions in enacting risk based security controls as part of a broader OT environment.

·       Facilitate key decisions involving OT architecture and technologies.

·       Advance security team accomplishments and competence by planning delivery of solutions; answering technical and procedural questions for less experienced team members; teaching improved processes; mentoring team members.

·       Ensure the full documentation of security designs, as built architectures and operational processes through clear diagrams and well-written documents.

 

OT Security Roadmap and Strategy 

·       Collaborate with the CISO, Sr Mgr OT Security Architecture, cybersecurity team, portfolio managers, other architects, and I&T leadership to understand the business direction and consequent impact on the security posture. 

·       Define the proper course of action and investment strategy by building business cases and security roadmaps.

·       Engage the OT vendor ecosystem to understand capabilities and limitations to drive improvements in the security posture of current products, and assist in the selection of the right partners.

·       Continuously monitor and evaluate the environment through self-assessments and independent security reviews. Enable management to identify deficiencies and inefficiencies and to initiate improvement actions though security roadmap and strategies.

Requirements

Education/Certification/Designation

·       Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, System Analysis or other relevant field

·       At least one recognized security certification: e.g. Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Global Industrial Cyber Security Professional (GICSP), ISA/IEC 62443 Cybersecurity Expert, etc.

·       Architecture related certifications (TOGAF, Zachman, CISSP-ISSAP, etc.) preferred


Skills/Knowledge

·       Ability to define and organise an architecture security apparatus in reusable building blocks: patterns, services, components, capability models, etc;

·       Demonstrated capability to understand the security implications of complex business operations and how they are linked to technological solutions that provide practical risk mitigation and business enablement;

·       Strong knowledge of the processes, methodologies, tools and techniques, used for building large information technology systems;

·       Proven experience in applying a structured approach to problem resolution in large, geographically dispersed organizations with 24/7 operations;

·       Strong knowledge of the technologies and architecture principles required to build complex operational technology systems such as: Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs); Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA); Distributed Control Systems (DCS); Human Machine Interface (HMI); Industrial network ports and protocols (such as TCP/IP, UDP, DNP3, Modbus, IEC 61850, PROFINET, OPC, LonWorks, DALI, BACnet, KNX, EnOcean, etc.); etc;

·       Deep understanding of ICS design considerations with emphasis on human safety and the availability/security of operating environment as well as threats, vulnerabilities, and exploits in ICS environments and appropriate mitigation techniques.

·       Ability to derive security requirements from vaguely formulated business needs;

·       Ability to interact with a broad cross-section of personnel to explain and enforce security measures

·       Excellent written and verbal communication skills;

·       Detail-oriented self-starter with a high level of commitment and personal motivation;

·       Knack for prioritizing tasks and working in a fast-paced environment;

·       Knowledge of standards, regulations and legislation governing Information Security, e.g. NIST, ISO 27001, OWASP, ISA 62443;

 

Experience 

·       Minimum 12 years overall IT work experience 

·       Minimum 8 years OT experience 

·       Minimum 5 years experience in OT security architecture experience

Assets (if applicable)

·       Software development experience

·       Experience with Agile and DevOps methodologies 

·       Knowledge of general IT security architecture and technologies including: service-oriented-architectures, mobile technologies including Mobile Device Management (MDM), data-centric design, advanced analytics, AI, Identity and Access Management (IAM) lifecycles, Digital Forensics, End Point Encryption, Encryption Key Management, Database Security, Enterprise Directory Services, IDS, IPS, Next Generation Firewall, Application Firewall, Enterprise Password Vaults , Cloud SaaS /PaaS/IaaS Security, SIEM, etc.

·       Deep knowledge of security foundations: cryptography, Root of Trust, security models, etc. 

·       Experience with NGFW, VPN, IPS/BDS, vulnerability management, access management, SIEM, and endpoint security in OT environments

·       Railroad, transportation, or Global industrial experience is a significant plus

Working Conditions

Occasional business travel (Canada and US) in accordance with CN policy 

About CN

 

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

 

For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee\'s experience.

CN requires that all employees be fully vaccinatedagainst COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. TheCompany’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly ownedsubsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers andanyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Intern, Enterprise Architecture
item.description:
At CN, everydaybrings new and exciting challenges. You can expect an interesting environmentwhere you’re part of making sure ourbusiness is running optimally and safely―helping keep the economy on track. We welcome students who share theirideas, perspectives and understanding of newtechnologies withour teams. In return, we provide the opportunity towork on exciting projects with experienced collaborators who are happy to share their knowledge, all within a mutually-agreed to framework. Youwill be able to thrive in our close-knit, safety-focused culture workingtogether as ONE TEAM. The opportunities we offer are meaningful because thework we do matters. Join us! 

Canadian National Railway Company (CN) is looking for a highly motivated person to fulfill a full-time (40h/week) Intern, Enterprise Architecture position in Canada for summer 2023 (May – August).

Job Summary

The Intern, Enterprise Architecture is responsible for supporting emerging technologies and innovation practices. The incumbent researches the latest technology trends applicable to railroading and has the opportunity to communicate trends and innovations to the larger CN I&T community. The role is exposed to the fundamental workings of the railroad across many business disciplines as well as to Research and Development (R&D), architecture, and solution delivery best practices. The position is performed within a team of experienced thought leaders and passionate professionals that solve exciting enterprise challenges in a fun and collaborative atmosphere. The exceptional breadth of exposure to numerous opportunities from “classic” mainframe systems to the bleeding edge of distributed Artificial Intelligence (AI), from telecom to finance and everything in between provides a unique opportunity to understand the workings of a large supply chain enabler.

Major Responsibilities

  • Learn the key elements of railroading
  • Research technology trends in the railroad and adjacent industries then document how they would be applied
  • Prepare technical radars and reports for specific innovation topics
  • Assess potential suppliers on their product and service offering, including both start-ups and market leaders
  • Support the delivery of proof of concept and prototyping initiatives, including business cases, data gathering, and delivery planning
  • Develop and execute innovative communication strategies for digital tools such as Yammer and SharePoint
  • Create standard templates for research requests
  • Shadow meetings with research partners and suppliers

Requirements

  • Shows initiative and empowers others
  • Identifies opportunities
  • Solves problems using analytical thinking
  • Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience
  • Collaborates with others
  • Deals with pressure and change by staying calm to quickly adapt to changes
  • Knowledge of Scientific written communication and technology principles
  • Knowledge of AI, Machine Learning, Internet of Things (IoT), Big Data, Computer Vision, advanced analytics, automation, and positioning technologies
  • Knowledge of technologies and practices such as Optimizers, Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAVs), wearables, extended reality, Blockchain, autonomous vehicles, digital twins, edge computing, control towers, data governance, and railroad operations*
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
  • Knowledge of Teams and SharePoint

Education

  • Working towards a Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or Business

*Any experience/education/skills/knowledge for these above would be considered as an asset

About CN  

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results. 

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Senior Business Data Analyst
item.description:
At CN, everyday brings new and exciting challenges. You can expect an interesting environment where you’re part of making sure our business is running optimally and safely―helping keep the economy on track. We provide the kind of paid training and opportunities that long-term careers are built on and we recognize hard workers who strive to make a difference. You will be able to thrive in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!


Job Summary

The Senior Business Data Analyst is responsible for working on initiatives supporting CN’s Smart Terminal Program through enabling data-driven decision making by creating and publishing actionable metrics and developing insights via data mining and analytics.  The incumbent ensures successful preparation and adoption of new technologies, supports the timely execution of Smart Terminal Program activities and plays a key role in enabling technology transformation.  Moreover, the incumbent develops a framework for data analytics within the Smart Terminal Program in order to provide business insights through the evaluation of traditional and non-traditional data.

Main Responsibilities

Develop Dashboards and Reports

·       Develop dashboards, metrics, and reports to enable data-driven decision making

·       Publish and distribute reports through automated means

·       Ensure data quality and data integrity in published analytics

·       Work with Intermodal Operations to collect and develop business requirements

·       Present and explain results to Intermodal and Operations teams

·       Develop a deep understanding of available data sources quality and reporting

·       Organize database of test data and create trend analysis charts and metrics

·       Ensure data quality in key systems through audits, Quality Assurance (QA) and Quality Control (QC)

·       Work with Information and Technology (I&T), Terminal Operating System as well as Telematics providers to ensure systems reporting accuracy

·       Assist in product functionality enhancement discussions through data driven understanding of current state and anticipated future state

·       Work with multiple departments to assess their needs for report scheduling and automation

·       Work with Robotic Process Automation (RPA) team to address report scheduling and other information update requirements

Business Data Analytics Framework

·       Evaluate business processes, and requirements, identify areas of improvement and develop solutions

·       Develop a framework for data analytics to provide business insights through the evaluation of traditional and non-traditional data

·       Oversee data processing efforts to ensure timely identification and correction of issues

·       Identify opportunities for process changes and tools to improve data quality and reporting

·       Effectively communicate analysis to key stakeholders and serve as a key liaison between stakeholders and users

·       Advance data structure requirements

Data Analytics and Modelling

·       Develop new business insights through data science and analytics

·       Work with external vendors and I&T counterparts to develop analytics capabilities with key systems and analytics tools

·       Support operations planning by providing key information necessary for developing high quality plan

·       Be compliant in handling and processing confidential company data as per guidelines

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday. The incumbent must be available to work shifts and weekends when necessary. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure and manage stress. The role requires occasional travel (15%) to various North American terminals.

Requirements

Experience

Data Design and Analytics

·       Minimum 3 years of experience in data design and analytics

Education/Certification/Designation

·       Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Business, or equivalent

Competencies

·       Collaborates with others and shares information

·       Sets direction and inspires others

·       Communicates with impact

·       Knows the business and stays current on industry needs

·       Applies critical thinking

·       Demonstrates agility and drives change

Technical Skills/Knowledge

·       Knowledge of Microsoft Office

·       Subject Matter Expertise (SME) in Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Cloud Based Solutions, and Data Science

·       Knowledge of railroad operations and railroad engineering

·       Knowledge of data analysis tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Business Objects, Systems, Applications and Products (SAP) Business Warehouse (BW), and R

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.


 

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Specialist Business Analyst
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

 

Job Summary
The Specialist Business Analysis is responsible for identifying, eliciting, analyzing, specifying, and validating the business needs of users throughout CN and for specific projects or initiatives in the area of Rail Operational Technology. The Specialist acts as a liaison between the I&T groups (architecture, design, delivery, quality assurance, project management, technical SMEs) and the business and translates needs into detailed stakeholder requirements/user stories, which the Specialist will follow through the project life cycle.

This role will give you the opportunity to contribute to our onboard locomotive technology roadmaps and participate hands-on on initiatives to modernize and evolve the onboard locomotive systems.


Main Responsibilities

·       Elicit, analyze, validate and document business requirements

·       Evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs

·       Translate business requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria to be used by partners for the delivery of the solutions

·       Understand the solution gaps and communicate the impacts to the business

·       Be the liaison between business and implementation teams

·       Maintain requirements changes traceability

·       Work with the product manager to ensure that the Product Backlog is visible, transparent, and clear to all, and shows what the teams will work on next

·       Work closely with business partners and key IT groups (Architecture, Design, Change Management, Quality Assurance, Delivery, Project Management, etc.) to ensure successful project delivery

·       Apply, and ensure compliance with, all CN IT standards (Security, Architecture, Project Delivery Methodology, etc.)

·       Manage requirements throughout the life of the project

·       Lead cross-functional collaboration with other projects or programs to validate business needs

·       Understand cross-project dependencies to align project deliverables

·       Contribute to the development of the Business Analysis practice

·       Provide peer-review and share business analysis best practices within the team

 


Working Conditions

·       Hybrid mode aligned with the role / projects needs

·       Travel in North America may be required occasionally

Requirements

Experience

·       Minimum 5 years of relevant work experience

·       Minimum 5 years of experience in business analysis waterfall / agile and processes

·       Experience with Data Analytics

·       Experience with communications protocols

·       Experience working in a safety environment

·       Experience within the rail industry, transportation, aerospace or telecom is considered an asset

·       Familiar with process mapping and project management methodology

·       Familiar with software development life cycle

·       Familiar with Agile methodologies

 

Education/Certification/Designation

·       Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems or other relevant fields or equivalent experience

·       CBAP Certification*

·       SAFe Certification*

·       Scrum Master and/or Product Owner Certification*

 

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset


Competencies

  • High level of autonomy, time management / prioritization and self-starter
  • Demonstrated success working with business and engineering teams to plan, develop, refine, and launch successful solution deliveries / products
  • Demonstrated ability to organize and facilitate workshops, interviews, and meetings, mindful of the impact of organizational change
  • Demonstrated ability to analyze, synthesize, document, translate and communicate business information to technical teams and vice versa
  • Quick learner and curious
  • Motivated and open to learn technical aspects of locomotive systems
  • Experience working with complex systems in large organizations
  • Excellent verbal and written communication and negotiation skills
  • Technical Skills/Knowledge
  • Process mapping
  • JIRA and Azure Dev Ops tools

·       Confluence tool

 

 

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

 

 

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

 

Job Summary

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance contributes to the SAP ecosystem roadmap by planning, executing and providing expertise on data-related activities.  The role is instrumental as CN is currently undertaking a large multi-year business transformation program triggered by a SAP ECC to a SAP S/4 HANA product migration.

 

The incumbent works within a multi-disciplinary team and participates in a variety of data activities, namely: profiling, quality assessment and cleansing of master and transactional data objects, including establishment of data cleansing strategies and their implementation;  master data mapping, transformation and enrichment, to account for new SAP product data models and business transformation  requirements; and data governance and management tasks on approval workflows, configurations and processes to ensure data objects maintain compliance to CN quality standards throughout their lifecycle.

 

The incumbent contributes to data validation runs, troubleshooting, data reconciliation and identification of corrective actions prior to production migrations.

The position helps develop skills and experience in setting up and managing best-in-class data pipelines that are becoming essential building block in industries adopting data-centric digital transformation approaches.

 

Main Responsibilities

Data Profiling and Cleansing – Data-Related Tasks on the “As-Is” Environment – 30%

Participates in data objects identification and business  rules profiling

Performs data  quality  assessment and quality  metrics reporting

Participates in manual/automated data object cleansing strategies and their implementation

Collaborates to the iterative post-cleansing validation and implementation of corrective measures

Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools to carry out tasks

 

Data Mapping and Transformation - Data-Related Tasks on the “To-Be” Environment – 40%

Participates in identification and design of functional data mapping, transformation and enrichment activities and documentation according to the business process re-engineering efforts and new S/4 HANA data structures

Implements sandbox solutions to assess data mapping and transformation methods, including algorithms

Performs iterative validation runs and implement corrective measures on conversions

Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools and conversion platforms to carry out tasks

 

Data Governance and Management - Data-Related Tasks on the Data Lifecycle and Enhancements – 30%

Identifies, implements, and validates governance workflow and data business rules requirements for master data management, in conjunction with business owners

Takes part in data quality assessment on target systems

Implements data governance roadmap and strategy on specialized data management tools and platforms

Participates in functional designs and documentation, system configuration, and validation

Maps enterprise-level data governance requirements into SAP landscape

 

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress.

 

Requirements

Experience

Managing and Handling Enterprise Data

Between 1 to 3 years of experience in managing and handling enterprise data

Education/Certification/Designation

Bachelor’s Degree in a technical or business field, with an interest in data management

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science or  Engineering*

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

 

Competencies

Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing

Applies analytical thinking

Innovates through problem solving

Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work

Demonstrates organizational abilities

Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity

Works independently with little supervision

 

Technical Skills/Knowledge

Strong interest in managing and validating data, understanding its attributes, characteristics and business value.

Hands-on experience in planning and executing general Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) data tasks*

Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, in particular SAP (SAP ECC, SAP S/4 HANA)*

Strong interest in business processes and the way data interrelates to those processes

Interest in exploring data, performing investigation and analysis, and applying resolution and validation in complex data sets

Knowledge of Excel or equivalent productivity tools

Ability and interest in developing advanced user knowledge of specialized data management platforms and tools such as Syniti Advanced Data Migration (ADM), SAP Master Data Governance (MDG), SAP Utopia, SAP Asset Information Workbench (AIW)

Ability to present and communicate results clearly

Knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL) statements and scripting, including SQL Server Management Studio*

*Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset

 

Organizational Impact

Decision Making & Impacts

The position performs data-centric tasks that are foundational to the SAP ecosystem roadmap and lifecycle

 

Level of Interaction/Influence

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance interacts with business and Information and Technology (I&T) data experts, Coordinators, Data Technology Specialists, Solution Architects, enterprise-level data governance teams, as well as working closely with their business and functional counterparts in Finance, Procurement, Supply Management, Mechanical and Engineering organizations. 

Employees Supervised/Organizational Structure

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance reports to the Senior Manager, SAP S/4 HANA Transformation, Data Governance and Migration, Information and Technology. The role has no supervisory responsibilities.

 

 

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

 

 

CN requires that all employees in Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. The Company’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly owned subsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers and anyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

 

For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee\'s experience.

TheCompany’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly ownedsubsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers andanyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.


 

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Specialist- Data Engineering
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Specialist Data Engineering is responsible for building, managing, and optimizing data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers, shaping the enterprise Data as a Service (DaaS) model and delivering on IT business models. The Specialist Data Engineering develops best practices and optimizes data pipelines to deliver products and services aligned with business expectations. The incumbent plays a pivotal role in operationalizing data and analytics initiatives, defining and building CN’s data integration and DaaS platform roadmap.

Main Responsibilities

Data Engineering 

·       Ensure optimal data delivery architecture and processes are consistent throughout ongoing projects

·       Optimize CN’s data architecture to support the next generation of products and data initiatives

·       Build, manage, and optimize data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers such as business or data analysts and data scientists

·       Build data and domain event models, implement business rules, and engineer scalable data pipelines

·       Ensure compliance with data governance and security requirements while creating, improving and operationalizing integrated and reusable data pipelines

·       Enable faster data access, integrate data reuse, and improve time-to-solution for data and analytics initiatives

·       Integrate analytics and data science results with business processes

·       Promote effective data management practices

Data Design 

·       Collaborate with stakeholders and architects to model data landscape and define secure data exchange approaches

·       Meet with stakeholders to identify fit-for-purpose within CN’s existing data ecosystem and deliver options and agile solutions

·       Design and develop processing pipelines that ingest data into Data Hubs

·       Provide day-to-day support and technical expertise to both technical and non-technical teams

·       Participate in building data engineering expertise and framework

·       Translate business needs into technical requirements

Data Development

·       Acquire, ingest and process data from multiple sources and systems

·       Design and develop Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) pipelines using multiple sources of data in various formats

·       Conduct metadata management, data cleansing and preparation

·       Produce well documented quality codes

Data Operations 

·       Use Agile methodologies to streamline project delivery aligned with goals, timelines, and budget

·       Build monitoring and debugging tools to analyze data pipelines

·       Help unify software development and operations seamlessly, efficiently, and cost effectively

·       Improve software quality, automate processes, and accelerate software releases

Data Quality Assurance

·       Use Agile development practises for code reviews and testing to develop and deliver data pipelines

·       Develop and implement test plans and scripts for various data quality processes

·       Maintain manual and automated test scripts

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday and offers remote work.


Requirements

Experience

Data Engineering

·       Minimum 5 years of experience in a data engineering role, working in different data management disciplines including data integration, modelling, optimization and quality

·       Experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with business stakeholders in support of a departmental or multi-departmental data management and analytics initiative

·       Experience with Scala or Java

·       Experience with SQL and NoSQL technologies

·       Fluent in writing, executing, and optimizing SQL queries

·       Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hive and Spark

·       Experience with Cloud platforms such as Azure, Google Platform or Databricks

·       Experience with Linux and shell scripting or Python

·       Experience in data profiling

·       Develop clean and maintainable code in a CI/CD environment (DevOps)

·       Experience in writing unit tests

·       Experience in translating business requirements into advanced data models able to fulfill analysts and data scientists requirements

.      Experience working in an Agile team environment

 

Education/Certification/Designation

·       Bachelor\'s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Software Engineering

·       Google or Azure Data Engineering certification*

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

Competencies

·       Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing

 .     Strong interpersonal relations, motivated and loves to work on multiple challenging projects

·       Well organized and able to self-prioritize, sometimes with conflictual deadlines

·       Continuously seeks for improvements and craves to put hands on new technologies

·       Ability to communicate complex solutions

·       Applies analytical thinking

·       Innovates through problem solving

·       Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work

·       Demonstrates organizational abilities and detail oriented

·       Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity

·       Works independently with little supervision

·       Applies agile mindset

·       Ability to work across structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data, extracting information and identifying linkages across disparate data sets

·       Demonstrates commitment to high standards of ethics, regulatory compliance, customer service, and business integrity

Technical Skills/Knowledge

·       Strong data analytics and development skills

·       Demonstrated creativity skills

·       Expertise in a combination of Scala, Java or Python

·       Expertise with Big Data architecture and distributed computing processes and platforms such as Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Kafka, etc.

·       Expertise with one or more SQL-on-Hadoop technology (Hive, Impala, Spark SQL, Presto)

·       Knowledge of software engineering best practices such as code reviews, testing frameworks, maintainability and readability

·       Expertise with Apache Storm*

·       Expertise with Databricks Delta Lake*

*Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset

Organizational Impact

Decision Making & Impacts

The Specialist Data Engineering is accountable for working with business stakeholders, Data and IT subject matter experts, and business leads to plan and delivery on the strategy and implementation roadmap of data pipelines.

Level of Interaction/Influence

The Specialist Data Engineering interacts primarily (80%) with internal stakeholders and partially (20%) with external contacts.

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.



 

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist - C360 Insights Team
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

The C360 Insights Team is part of the Campaign Management & Data Science group that supports one to one Marketing Campaigns for TELUS’ Mobility Customers. Our team is responsible for providing advanced analytics solutions to inform marketing campaigns that help deliver best in class customer experiences and business results for the organization. We develop machine learning and AI solutions leveraging the latest technology and Big Data assets that TELUS maintains.

 

We are a team of highly skilled and experienced data analytics professionals with diverse industry experience who collaborate to create value for our customers, organization and team.

 

Always wanted to work in a high performance team that strives to continuously grow and be part of a culture that embraces creativity, collaboration, diversity and a whole lot of fun? If so, we’d love to talk with you!

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As a Data Scientist, reporting to the Manager C360 Insights Team, you will play a pivotal role in enabling TELUS’ Marketing teams to achieve their business goals including revenue, EBITDA, churn, customer experience by developing advanced analytics solutions that support marketing strategy and campaigns.

 

As TELUS evolves its AI capabilities including Next Best Action engines, Customer Journey analytics solutions and transition to Cloud platforms you will be a key contributor and user of these capabilities.

 

You will work with a talented team of Data Scientists as well as analytics and marketing professionals to build advanced analytics solutions and derive business value from them.

 

Here\'s how

 

  • Contribute to the development of teams’ deliverables like Next Best Action engines, Propensity Models, Natural Language Processing models, Near Real time Triggers, Customer Journey Analytics, Data Dashboards that inform marketing strategy and campaigns leveraging PySPARK, Python, SQL, etc
  • Own the end-to-end analysis including pre-analysis, trigger detection, predictive modeling and post campaign analysis
  • Present customer insights to cross-functional business partners including Marketing, Channel, Products & Services, Customer Experience and Digital
  • Support the transition of TELUS’ data assets and analytics machine learning solutions to Google Cloud Platform ensuring data security and privacy compliance
  • Maintain solid and updated knowledge in the domain of AI/ machine learning to continuously evolve TELUS’s AI assets while collaborating with and adding value to your fellow data science community
  • Work collaboratively with business partners teams to understand, compartmentalize complex and ambiguous business issues into crisp and manageable pieces

 

 

Qualifications

 

Must haves

 

  • Technical Expertise
    • Extensive Hands-on and industry experience in Python, SPARK, SQL and other data query language on UNIX / PC and comfortable working with very large data sets and databases
    • Extensive Hands-on experience with a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks
    • Knowledge of advanced statistical and data mining techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with business applications
    • Experience with Data Visualization tools like Domo/Tableau
    • Strong Quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills
    • 8+ years of progressive and relevant work experience
  • Business Orientation
    • Good business acumen, relationship management and influencing without authority skills
    • Ability to provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis
    • Strong Ability to prioritize tasks from multiple stakeholders and meet deadlines with quality deliverables
    • Strong written, oral, communications, presentation skills and knowledge of Microsoft office/Google suite
  • Education
    • Masters/PhD degree in Computer Science Engineering/ Programming/ Statistics/Analytics

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Telecom industry experience
  • Working experience with Google Cloud Platform

 

Above all else we are seeking an enthusiastic ‘let’s do it’ attitude, motivation and a willingness to learn and collaborate. Please consider transferable skills, which will make you successful in this role and apply!

item.title: Design Specialist II
item.description:
Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The wireless engineering team is a group of highly motivated and talented RF Designers who have a passion for deploying the network infrastructure to achieve best in class network services to our customers. We are the team that engineer our 5G national RAN network.

The team is always at the cutting edge of wireless technology delivering the newest and the best services to our customers. With the advent of 5G, you will have the opportunity to work with peer RF Designers to design the network while leveraging your automation, data science, and machine learning skills.

TELUS is searching for a Designer with extensive experience in RF Design, strong business acumen and leadership skills. As a Senior RF Designer, you will collaborate closely with the client-facing business units offering solutions to future & existing customers in a variety of business different verticals. Your leadership and creativity will serve to understand the customer’s challenges and to design a technical solution that surpasses their expectations by leveraging all that 5G has to offer.

 

What you’ll do 


 
•    Using RF propagation modelling, you will develop novel techniques to simulate wireless coverage supporting the evolution of our networks (5G and IoT)
•    Collaborating with internal teams like Technology Strategy and Product Development to understand new technologies and services to prepare our team to succeed in an evolving business environment
•    Leveraging data analytics to define future network deployment strategy in a variety of business verticals.
•    Developing dashboards and data visualizations you will provide insight into network performance that can be shared with executives, peer groups and tools that are implemented in customer portals 
•    Keeping up-to-date with software, data science, and RF technologies while proposing new ideas for platforms and tools
 

What you bring


 
•    Bachelor degree in Engineering ( Electrical or Computer) 
•    Advanced presentation & communication skills. The successful candidate will be called upon to present highly technical material in an easily digestible manner at all levels of the organization and to potential customers
•    Commended for your inter-personal skills, critical thinking, analytical, and problem solving skills
•    A minimum of 10-year minimum experience in an RF engineering team, with a deep insight of industry standard propagation tools (ex. Planet, ATOLL) 
•    Experience in designing macro sites, small cells & and in-building coverage solutions
•    A sound knowledge of 3GPP (5G/LTE/UMTS/HSPA) radio access network design, optimization and capacity engineering
•    A strong understanding of databases and big data including MySQL, NoSQL databases, SPLUNK, Python and Alteryx
•    Passionate about automation, data science, and machine learning


 
Great-to-haves


 
•    Master degree in Engineering or Computer Science
•    MBA or similar business training certifications
•    Knowledge of Tableau, Splunk or Alteryx

item.title: Data Scientist - Data Operations and Analytics
item.description:
Let the data do the talking! If you love a challenge and love Data, this role is for you.

 

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

The Data Operations and Analytics team is an internally focused reporting and analytics product minded team within TELUS, responsible for reporting on key operational metrics to ensure we are delivering to our customers. We discover key insights into our outages and provide the day to day on our ability to deliver. The Reliability Center of Excellence mission is to aim for the highest degree of service reliability for our customers – and for our team. We are dedicated to support all aspects of improving reliability here within TELUS operations. Our team includes a passionate group of business analysts, network analysts, data analysts, data scientists and data engineers.

 

The Data Operations and Analytics team is looking for Data Scientists to play a key role in unlocking and driving outcomes for the Reliability Center of Excellence organization. This includes reporting results, uncovering insights, and developing AI/ML products that will enable our team to deliver on our Reliability promise.

 

As a Data Scientist on the team, you will collaborate with teams across the company, understanding the various areas within operations, seeking out new opportunities perfect for machine learning. Combining your expertise of data science with your strong software development skills, you will automate and facilitate data exploration, analytics, model development, training and deployment. 

 

Candidates for the role will be passionately curious to understand the ‘why’ behind the data and excited for the opportunity to play an integral role in steering a new data science team into maturity.

 

What you’ll do

 

 

  • Use data to tell the story of our operations and discover opportunities to improve our practices and enhance our decision-support ability
  • Explore raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insights
  • Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models
  • Manage end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to production
  • Develop re-usable code aimed at delivering on future goals faster and more reliably
  • Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities
  • Be an integral resource in the development and maturity of the data strategy within Data Operations and Analytics 

What you bring

 

  • A passion for how data can be used to uncover new insights, solve unique problems and drive effective actions
  • Be a strategic thinker and a bias for action and crafting and driving change
  • Be curious and creative in looking at metrics to identify and testing new critical metrics for the team
  • Have strong presentation skills with the ability to tell stories with data and master visualizations and be able to explain complex topics to non-technical audiences
  • You thrive in an environment where no playbook or rulebook exists, you will find a way through unforeseen challenges to obtain your goal
  • You value deploying the correct Machine Learning and AI solution for the task instead of relying on heavy computational neural networks
  • You are passionate about the learning new AI/ML techniques outside of your existing toolbox but has in-depth experience in one of the following: Linear Regression, Binary & Multiclass Logistic Regressions, K-means Clustering, Random Forests, Time Series Forecast, Matrix Factorization, LightBGM, Boosted Tree & XGBoost.
  • You have experience in NLP feature engineering and modeling (e.g., text classification, entity recognition, dependency parsing), NLU and Natural Language Inference.
  • You have mastered SQL and you develop in Python regularly and work with Pandas, Scikit-learn, and Numpy. You also have familiarity with Tensorflow.
  • You are a strong software developer and have experience with GitHub, and AI development lifecycles, including MLOps (CI/CD/CT)
  • You possess working knowledge of distributed computing and GPU computing and are familiar with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • Minimum of 3+ years of working with large data sets and analyzing data to identify patterns and in Writing and testing code proficiently 


Great to haves

 

  • Google Cloud Platform and tools knowledge 
  • Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent, or equivalent education and/or experience

item.title: Design Specialist II - Radio Access Network (RAN) Performance & Optimization Engineer
item.description:
Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As a member of TELUS’ wireless performance engineering team, you\'ll be responsible for optimizing the Radio Access Network (RAN), and finding new angles/methods to improve network performance, efficiently. You\'ll join the larger Wireless Networks & Services DevOps team that provides TELUS customers with the most reliable network and the best user experience, as we ready ourselves for an exciting and new 5G network. In this team, you\'ll ensure our customers\' wireless experience continuously improves. Your "think outside of the box" and innovation mentality will help shape our key performance indicators (KPIs) which we use to govern our customers\' wireless experience.


What you’ll do 

 

  • You\'ll be responsible for the wireless network performance in Western Canada
  • You’ll be optimizing our RAN as we upgrade the infrastructure through band additions and 5G deployments
  • You’ll ensure network performance KPIs are meeting our targets, and are continuously improving
  • You’ll troubleshoot network degradations, determine root causes, and look for ways to prevent or reduce the impact to our customers
  • You’ll support network upgrades by analyzing the impacts on performance, and proposing optimizations to enrich the overall customer experience
  • You’ll aid our client support teams for escalated issues that may require network engineering to resolve
  • You’ll be exposed to the latest wireless technology innovation planned for TELUS, and be ready to support their launch from a performance management perspective

What you bring 

 

  • With 10+ years of relevant professional experience
  • Recognized for your excellent knowledge of LTE and NR radio access network performance and optimization: parameter/feature optimization, signaling analysis, mobility management, traffic balancing, and self-optimizing network (SON) features
  • Respected for your RAN equipment knowledge (at least two of Huawei/Nokia/Samsung): parameters, capabilities and limitations of the hardware and software portfolio
  • Regarded for your wireless core network knowledge (VoLTE, EPC, IMS) and 5G technology roadmap
  • Acknowledged for your proficiency with the OSS (at least two of Huawei U2000 / Nokia NetAct / Samsung USM), call trace tools (ActixOne, Netscout)
  • Skilled in data science: data manipulation, statistical analysis, machine learning and automation
  • Confident with SQL, SPLUNK, Python (or other scripting languages)
  • With a Bachelor degree in Engineering or related studies

 
Great-to-haves
 

  • Passion, initiative, and a continuous improvement and learning mindset 
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, and strong presentation skills
  • Strong collaboration, teamwork and networking skills

item.title: Senior Product/Project Manager - Collaborative Health
item.description:
Join our team

 

TELUS Health is transforming healthcare by delivering connected solutions and services to empower people to live healthier lives.

 

We are explorers and passionate system thinkers. We are builders and dedicated craftspeople. We are connectors and agents of change. Our thinking is grounded in an appreciation for relentless discovery, and a holistic view of the industry, market, or organization. Our efforts are grounded in a sincere commitment to translate insight into opportunity, opportunity into concepts, concepts into products and products into businesses.  We achieve this with a dedication to our craft and collaboration at our core.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

At TELUS SKY, we’ve developed a future thinking integrated ecosystem for true health, wellness and behavioral care that bridges in-person and virtual experiences. Specifically, the SKY Experience assembles people, technologies and science into a single intuitive process that combines the best of premium in-person experiences with a seamless digital platform. By doing so, we are building one of the richest databases of wellbeing biomarkers, physical, psychological, sociological indicators. Combined with advancements in artificial intelligence (AI), we will have the ability to reexamine standard assumptions of care to impact individual health journeys.

 

We are currently looking for a blend of Senior Product / Project Manager to create a frictionless digital experience, working very closely with the Sr UX / CX experience designer. In this position, you will work with cross-functional teams to analyze business requirements, research, design, integrate, and deploy new technologies. The Senior Product/Project Manager will also manage effective relationships with internal stakeholders, regional partners, technology vendors and service providers.

 

 

What you’ll do: 

 

 

  • Create and drive the integration strategy and roadmap to connect various platforms in order to provide an end to end seamless customer experience
  • Contribute to the creation of a multi-year product strategy and roadmap for SKY that expertly balances innovation with reinforcing our commitments to members
  • Work closely together with the various TELUS LoB strategy, design and product teams to identify technological integration opportunities and align on strategies, roadmaps, priorities and dependencies that provide direct business value to our SKY members.
  • Lead the execution of the developed project roadmap
  • Partner with cross-functional Product and Developer teams and industry experts to explore how Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI/ML) technologies can better support our journey.
  • Work with our data science team to create a roadmap for future automated actions based on ML models
  • Facilitate, communicate, collaborate, negotiate between customer and technical teams to bring features to closure

What you bring:

 

  • You have 2+ years of Product or 7 + years of Project Management experience, ideally in SaaS
  • You are obsessed with delivering the most customer-centric experience, showing proven success in ownership, bias for action, and thinking big.
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a relevant field, or equivalent certifications and work experience
  • Visionary, innovative, forward-thinking and profoundly customer focused
  • The flexibility to quickly adapt and produce in a rapidly changing environment, meeting aggressive product launch schedules
  • Track record working in high-growth environments, and a comfort level with the pace of change and level of ambiguity that accompanies this
  • Ability to work independently. Self-starter, can-do attitude, ability to multitask and prioritize within and across complex projects
  • Strong relationship development skills - experienced in building and strengthening internal and external relationships over time, savvy at navigating negotiations and tradeoffs with current and prospective partners
  • Broad interest in healthcare innovation that spans digital, hardware/devices, and healthcare services

 

 

Why TELUS Health?

 

At TELUS, Collaborative Health you’ll join a diverse team dedicated to learning, teaching, and impact; as individuals and as a team. As a workplace, we care about our team members and have a total rewards package that makes being a part of TELUS Health something to be proud of:

 

  • 100% remote within Canada: so you can work where you feel most inspired (in-person if YOU want to!)
  • Stay healthy: flex benefits with options to customize coverage based on your lifestyle and needs, inclusively offering coverage for Gender Affirmation and Fertility treatments
  • Virtual Care: premium access to digital healthcare for you and a loved one; avoid long waits at the clinic, just chat with a medical professional from your couch
  • Work Life Integration: paid vacation and flexible well-being days
  • Family leave: mothers, fathers and adoptive parents benefit from a top-up during part of their leave
  • Pension plan: to help you save for the future with a generous company match (free money!)
  • Employee Share Purchase Plan: you can invest in our shared success, company matched
  • Wellness Spending Account: To support your whole person wellness
  • Learning and development: Internal resources for business, leadership, and technical skills 
  • Savings: who doesn’t love discounts? (on TELUS services and partner/supplier services and products)
  • Employee and family assistance: LifeWorks provides free services to support you through life events
  • Tools/Technology: Mac or PC, whichever enables you to do your best work

 

#LI-Remote

item.title: Design Specialist II - RAN Development
item.description:
Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

This is an opportunity to join a highly technical, dynamic team during a transformational journey. The RAN Development & New Service Introduction team is a group of highly motivated engineers who have a passion for developing and implementing new technologies to support our customers increasing demand for wireless service.

You will have the opportunity not only to influence the introduction of new technologies and leverage your expertise of modern engineering best practices, including automation and machine learning but also to build a wireless network that delivers continued award-winning customer experiences.

 

What you’ll do 

 

  • Responsible for LTE and 5G RAN network hardware, software, and feature new technology introduction
  • Proactively Communicate/clarify TELUS requirements to vendors and evaluates responses
  • Translate LTE/5G technical aspects into business impact and vice versa, plus E2E integration requirement 
  • Propose solutions and features optimization engineering guidelines, provide support for field teams
  • Plan the execution of the TELUS strategy and get involved in the execution 
  • Validate vendor compliance to industry/TELUS standards and the functional and performance requirements by conducting lab proof of concept and interoperability testing with other systems, etc
  • Communicate and present cross-team to explain the technical decisions and their outcomes
  • Apply a ‘Reliability by design’ approach during the new technology planning and rollout steps

What you bring

 

Solid knowledge of LTE/5G RF design and optimization (5+ years’ experience)
Understand future network technology evolution: HeNet (small cell), AI & Machine learning, MEC, 5G Network slicing, and SDN/virtualization, Cloud technology
Familiar with 3GPP spec., including air interface implementation, RRM, MM, and RF compliance
Understand basic knowledge of IP, Video streaming, Multicast, and other networking protocols
Hands-on experience with the network/performance testing tools such as IXIA, SmartBits, Chariot, QXDM, Agilent drive testing tool, XCAL, TEMS, and Actix tool IP based application knowledge and exposure to network security would also be assets
5 or more years performing lab testing evaluations including and not limited to proof of concept. Experience in writing test plans for different scenarios, collecting requirements from users
Ability to provide on-demand, specialized technical advice for the technical solution of several wide-ranging problems and to interact with others including on a proactive customer-focused basis
Familiar with wireless network troubleshooting procedure and performance enhancement process with knowledge related

Master degree in telecom 
P.Eng or Eng designation

item.title: Data/ML Engineer
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

Join the Procurement Analytics Center of Excellence (PACE) and TELUS, and support our mission to transform the chief procurement office (CPO) into a fully digital organization where data is at the heart of every decision we make. Enable stakeholders to efficiently evolve and consume actionable insights through transformation strategies.

 

We are an advanced data and AI team thriving on solving business problems and supporting procurement decisions using the power of data, advanced analytics, and reliable software. We provide end-to-end support from strategy and development to deployment and monitoring of all assets, including machine learning model, Tableau dashboards, and data engineering ETLs using cutting-edge cloud technologies (e.g., Google BigQuery and GCP AI Platform), open source tools (e.g., Python, DBT, Nifi, Sklearn, NLTK, Tensorflow), and enterprise products (e.g., Tableau, GitHub, Terraform).

 

In achieving our goal of enabling data-driven decision-making in CPO, the PACE team is looking for an experienced data/ML engineer who can interpret the requirements of data and analytics use cases and scenarios, and drive the design and implementation of data pipelines and models to enable insights and analytics leading to better business decisions. 


What you’ll do:

 

As a Data/ML Engineer in PACE’s Insight Generation team, you will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and evolving our MLOps methodology for continuous delivery and integration of our data and model assets. You are also accountable for ingesting data from various sources and validating, normalizing, and cleaning data for business use, and deploying & maintaining ML models in production. The expectation is to go above and beyond your role in working with like-minded, entrepreneurial colleagues to strengthen the availability and reliability of our data following the state-of-the-art MLOps tech stack to support our data-driven decision-making culture. In this role, you are responsible to:
 

  • Developing, maintaining, and evolving our MLOps methodology
  • Design & build data extraction, loading, and transformation pipelines, and data products across on-prem and cloud platforms
  • Help integrate large datasets stemming from multiple data sources to be later used for data modeling and visualization
  • Own, design, and build the data pipelines feeding into our machine learning models
  • Own and develop relationships with various internal and external teams/vendors to bring data from across the organization to our central data/ML platform in the cloud
  • Bring systems design experience with the ability to architect and explain complex systems interactions, data flows, standard interfaces, and APIs
  • Assist in the extracting, loading, transforming, cleaning, and validating of data
  • Develop test strategies and site reliability engineering measures for data products & solutions
  • Supervise or contribute to quality assurance efforts to make sure that the ingested data has and keeps the expected quality
  • Look proactively at opportunities to blend data across different enterprise systems to generate actionable insights that drive business value
  • Perform technical data stewardship tasks including metadata management, security, and privacy by design
  • Mentor and coach other peers at PACE and upskill stakeholders to adopt and utilize reports, dashboards, and insights to inform day-to-day decision-making

 

Qualifications

 

Who you are:

 

  • Hold PhD or Master\'s degree with a major in computer science, software engineering, or applied mathematics (or related quantitative disciplines)
  • Minimum 7 years of experience with SQL and database proficiency
  • Minimum 5 years of experience with Python
  • Minimum 2 years of experience with databases and data pipelines on cloud platforms
  • Minimum 5 years of experience using data extraction and processing technologies.
  • Minimum 2 years of data solution architecture and design
  • Prior experience with Agile and Jira
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Ability to communicate data analytics and insights to business stakeholders
  • Ability to work and collaborate with team members

 

Great-to-have:

 

  • Knowledge and experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), including Google BigQuery
  • GCP Professional Data Engineering certification
  • Experience with job scheduling platforms and Orchestration (Apache NiFi, Apache airflow)
  • Familiar and preferably experienced with the life cycle of machine learning model development, deployment, and operationalization in large enterprises
  • Familiar with software development methodologies and best practices
  • DevOps and MLOPs practices and tools experience
  • Quality Assurance & Site Reliability Engineering
  • Familiarity with Data Build Tool (DBT)
  • Knowledge and experience with SAP S4 HANA, SAP ECC is a big asset

item.title: Full Stack Software Developer
item.description:
Description

 

Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies.
 

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The Reliability Data Engineering and Analytics Team at TELUS focusses on instantaneous detection of events that could lead to incidents, outages and negatively impact the customer experience.

 

As a Full Stack Software Developer, your innovative mindset, technical skills, and passion for growth will be critical in continuing to grow our data analytics practices for predictive insights and early detection of incidents. Be a part of the team that uses cutting edge technology to implement machine learning and predictive analytics which will shape tomorrow\'s AI Ops. 

 

What you’ll do

  • Fixing bugs fast and solving hard problems well

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • University Degree/Diploma in Computer Science or Engineering
  • 2 years’ experience using GCP cloud monitoring and logging
  • 1 year hands on experience with Looker development
  • At least 1+ years’ experience working with Big Query
  • At least 1+ years’ experience with CI/CD pipeline, can create Terraform scripts
